00060 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00061 #include <config.h>
00062 #include <stdio.h>
00063 #include "old_sm.h"
00064 #include <machine/mdes2.h>
00065 #include <library/l_alloc_new.h>
00066 
00067 #define DEBUG_RMAP_RESIZE 0
00068 #define DEBUG_RMAP 0
00069 #define TAKE_STATS 0
00070 
00071 static L_Alloc_Pool *OLD_SM_Cb_pool = NULL;
00072 
00073 /* Prototypes */
00074 void OLD_SM_commit_choices (unsigned int *map, SM_Table *table,
00075                         unsigned short *choices_made);
00076 
00077 OLD_SM_Cb *OLD_SM_new_cb (Mdes2 *mdes2, OLD_SM_Func *sm_func, L_Cb *cb)
00078 {
00079     OLD_SM_Cb *sm_cb;
00080 
00081     
00082     /* Alloc new sm_cb structure (initialize if necessary) */
00083     if (OLD_SM_Cb_pool == NULL)
00084         OLD_SM_Cb_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("OLD_SM_Cb", sizeof (OLD_SM_Cb), 16);
00085     sm_cb = (OLD_SM_Cb *) L_alloc (OLD_SM_Cb_pool);
00086 
00087     /* Initialize fields */
00088     sm_cb->sm_mdes = mdes2->sm_mdes;
00089     sm_cb->cb = cb;
00090     sm_cb->sm_func = sm_func;
00091 
00092 
00093     /* Initialize resource map fields */
00094     sm_cb->map_array = NULL;    /* Algorithm assumes set to NULL initially */
00095 
00096     /* The rest of the fields don't need to be intialized here */
00097     
00098     /* Return new created sm_cb structure */
00099     return (sm_cb);
00100 }
00101 
00102 void OLD_SM_delete_cb (OLD_SM_Cb *sm_cb)
00103 {
00104     /* Free the map array if necessary */
00105     if (sm_cb->map_array != NULL)
00106         free (sm_cb->map_array);
00107 
00108     /* Free the sm_cb structure */
00109     L_free (OLD_SM_Cb_pool, sm_cb);
00110 }
00111 
00112 void OLD_SM_check_map (OLD_SM_Cb *sm_cb)
00113 {
00114     int min_init_offset, max_init_offset, map_start_offset;
00115     unsigned int *map_array;
00116     int offset, errors;
00117 
00118     min_init_offset = sm_cb->min_init_offset;
00119     max_init_offset = sm_cb->max_init_offset;
00120     map_array = sm_cb->map_array;
00121     map_start_offset = sm_cb->map_start_offset;
00122 
00123     errors = 0;
00124     for (offset = min_init_offset; offset <= max_init_offset; offset++)
00125     {
00126         if (map_array[offset - map_start_offset] != ((unsigned int) offset))
00127         {
00128             printf ("Map mismatch, map_array[%i] = %i not %i!\n",
00129                     offset, map_array[offset - map_start_offset], offset);
00130             errors++;
00131         }
00132     }
00133 
00134     if (errors != 0)
00135         L_punt ("%i map mismatches!", errors);
00136 }
00137 void OLD_SM_expand_map_end_offset (OLD_SM_Cb *sm_cb, int max_init_offset)
00138 {
00139     int new_map_array_size, malloc_size;
00140     int map_start_offset, start_index, end_index;
00141     unsigned int *old_map_array, *new_map_array;
00142     int index1;
00143 
00144     /* Get the map_start_offset of speed and ease of use */
00145     map_start_offset = sm_cb->map_start_offset;
00146     
00147     /* Double the map array size until covers max_init_offset.*/
00148     new_map_array_size = sm_cb->map_array_size << 1;
00149     while ((map_start_offset + new_map_array_size) <= max_init_offset)
00150         new_map_array_size = new_map_array_size << 1;
00151 
00152 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00153     printf ("    Expanding map end offset from %i to %i (total size %i)\n",
00154             sm_cb->map_end_offset, 
00155             sm_cb->map_start_offset + new_map_array_size - 1,
00156             new_map_array_size);
00157 #endif
00158 
00159     /* Malloc the new array */
00160     malloc_size = new_map_array_size * sizeof(unsigned int);
00161     if ((new_map_array = (unsigned int *) malloc(malloc_size)) == NULL)
00162         L_punt ("OLD_SM_expand_map_end_offset: Out of memory (size %i)",
00163                 malloc_size);
00164 
00165 
00166     /* Copy the contents of the old map array to the new map.
00167      * Calculate the index bounds using the map start offset
00168      */
00169     old_map_array = sm_cb->map_array;
00170     start_index = sm_cb->min_init_offset - map_start_offset;
00171     end_index = sm_cb->max_init_offset - map_start_offset;
00172 
00173 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00174     printf ("      Transfering contents from %i to %i (start offset %i)\n",
00175             start_index, end_index, map_start_offset);
00176 #endif
00177 
00178     /* Do 4 copies per iteration to speed up the transfer.  Set up 
00179      * algorithm so that there is always a multiple of 4 elements 
00180      * that have been initialized!
00181      */
00182     for (index1 = start_index; index1 <= end_index; index1 += 4)
00183     {
00184         new_map_array[index1] = old_map_array[index1];
00185         new_map_array[index1+1] = old_map_array[index1+1];
00186         new_map_array[index1+2] = old_map_array[index1+2];
00187         new_map_array[index1+3] = old_map_array[index1+3];
00188     }
00189     
00190     /* Sanity check, make sure my multiple of 4 assumption has not
00191      * been broken!  (Comment out later for speed).
00192      */
00193     if ((index1 - 1) != end_index)
00194     {
00195         L_punt ("OLD_SM_expand_map_end_offset:\n"
00196                 "expect (end_index(%i) - start_index(%i)) = %i\n"
00197                 "to be (multiple of 4)-1!",
00198                 end_index, start_index, end_index-start_index);
00199     }
00200     
00201     
00202     /* Free the old map array */
00203     free (old_map_array);
00204 
00205     /* Point sm_cb at new array with old contents (if any) copied over */
00206     sm_cb->map_array = new_map_array;
00207     sm_cb->map_array_size = new_map_array_size;
00208 
00209     /* Update the map end offset (the start offset didn't change) */
00210     sm_cb->map_end_offset = map_start_offset + new_map_array_size -1;
00211     
00212 #if DEBUG_RMAP_RESIZE
00213     OLD_SM_check_map (sm_cb);
00214 #endif
00215 }
00216 
00217 void OLD_SM_expand_map_start_offset (OLD_SM_Cb *sm_cb, int min_init_offset)
00218 {
00219     int new_map_array_size, malloc_size, map_end_offset;
00220     int old_map_start_offset, new_map_start_offset, start_index, end_index;
00221     unsigned int *old_map_array, *new_map_array, *adjusted_new_map_array;
00222     int index1;
00223 
00224     /* Get the map_end_offset of speed and ease of use */
00225     map_end_offset = sm_cb->map_end_offset;
00226     
00227     /* Double the map array size until covers min_init_offset.*/
00228     new_map_array_size = sm_cb->map_array_size << 1;
00229     while (((map_end_offset + 1) - new_map_array_size) > min_init_offset)
00230         new_map_array_size = new_map_array_size << 1;
00231 
00232     /* Calculate the new map_start_offset */
00233     new_map_start_offset = (map_end_offset + 1) - new_map_array_size;
00234 
00235 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00236     printf ("    Expanding map start offset from %i to %i (total size %i)\n",
00237             sm_cb->map_start_offset, 
00238             sm_cb->map_end_offset + 1 - new_map_array_size,
00239             new_map_array_size);
00240 #endif
00241 
00242     /* Malloc the new array */
00243     malloc_size = new_map_array_size * sizeof(unsigned int);
00244     if ((new_map_array = (unsigned int *) malloc(malloc_size)) == NULL)
00245         L_punt ("OLD_SM_expand_map_end_offset: Out of memory (size %i)",
00246                 malloc_size);
00247 
00248 
00249     /* Copy the contents of the old map array to the new map.
00250      * Calculate the index bounds using the map start offset
00251      */
00252     old_map_start_offset = sm_cb->map_start_offset;
00253     old_map_array = sm_cb->map_array;
00254     start_index = sm_cb->min_init_offset - old_map_start_offset;
00255     end_index = sm_cb->max_init_offset - old_map_start_offset;
00256 
00257     /* Adjust the new_map_array pointer so can use same index as
00258      * old map array for copy.
00259      */
00260     adjusted_new_map_array = &new_map_array[old_map_start_offset - 
00261                                             new_map_start_offset];
00262 
00263 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00264     printf ("      Transfering contents from %i to %i (old start offset %i new %i diff %i)\n",
00265             start_index, end_index, old_map_start_offset, new_map_start_offset,
00266             old_map_start_offset - new_map_start_offset);
00267 #endif
00268 
00269     /* Do 4 copies per iteration to speed up the transfer.  Set up 
00270      * algorithm so that there is always a multiple of 4 elements 
00271      * that have been initialized!
00272      */
00273     for (index1 = start_index; index1 <= end_index; index1 += 4)
00274     {
00275         adjusted_new_map_array[index1] = old_map_array[index1];
00276         adjusted_new_map_array[index1+1] = old_map_array[index1+1];
00277         adjusted_new_map_array[index1+2] = old_map_array[index1+2];
00278         adjusted_new_map_array[index1+3] = old_map_array[index1+3];
00279     }
00280     
00281     /* Sanity check, make sure my multiple of 4 assumption has not
00282      * been broken!  (Comment out later for speed).
00283      */
00284     if ((index1 - 1) != end_index)
00285     {
00286         L_punt ("OLD_SM_expand_map_start_offset:\n"
00287                 "expect (end_index(%i) - start_index(%i)) = %i\n"
00288                 "to be (multiple of 4)-1!",
00289                 end_index, start_index, end_index-start_index);
00290     }
00291     
00292     
00293     /* Free the old map array */
00294     free (old_map_array);
00295 
00296     /* Point sm_cb at new array with old contents (if any) copied over */
00297     sm_cb->map_array = new_map_array;
00298     sm_cb->map_array_size = new_map_array_size;
00299 
00300     /* Update the map start offset (the end offset didn't change) */
00301     sm_cb->map_start_offset = new_map_start_offset;
00302 
00303 #if DEBUG_RMAP_RESIZE
00304     OLD_SM_check_map (sm_cb);
00305 #endif
00306 }
00307 
00308 void OLD_SM_init_for_max_usage (OLD_SM_Cb *sm_cb, int max_usage_offset)
00309 {
00310     unsigned int *map_array;
00311     int old_max_init_offset, new_max_init_offset, map_end_offset;
00312     int map_start_offset;
00313     int start_index, end_index, index1;
00314 
00315     /* Calculate how far to intialize the map to, want to extend past present
00316      * need.  Want to initialize at least 4 elements beyond max_usage_offset. 
00317      * 
00318      * In order to do some hand unrolling optimizations of the resize
00319      * and intialization routines, always make the number of elements
00320      * initialized to a multiple of 4.  Thus make new_max_init_offset a 
00321      * (multiple of 4) - 1 (since numbering starts at a multiple of 4).
00322      * 
00323      * To accomplish this, zero the lower bits of max_usage offset 
00324      * (in effect, subtract up to 3).  Now have a multiple of 4.
00325      * Add 7, so the new_max_init_offset is somewhere between 4 and 7 entries
00326      * larger than max_usage_offset, and is a (multiple of 4) - 1.
00327      */
00328     new_max_init_offset = (max_usage_offset - (max_usage_offset & 3)) + 7;
00329 
00330     /* Do we need to resize the map_array? 
00331      * If max_usage_offset would fall withing the current array, don't
00332      * resize, just extend initialization as far as possible.
00333      */
00334     map_end_offset = sm_cb->map_end_offset;
00335     if (map_end_offset < new_max_init_offset)
00336     {
00337         /* Try to scale back new_max_init_offset if possible to avoid resize */
00338         if (max_usage_offset <= map_end_offset)
00339         {
00340             /* Since map_end_offset always a (multiple of 4)-1, unrolling
00341              * optimizations will still hold after setting to map_end_offset.
00342              */
00343             new_max_init_offset = map_end_offset;
00344         }
00345 
00346         /* Otherwise expand the map_end_offset to handle new_max_init_offset */
00347         else
00348         {
00349             OLD_SM_expand_map_end_offset (sm_cb, new_max_init_offset);
00350         }
00351     }
00352 
00353     /* Get sm_cb fields for speed and ease of use */
00354     map_start_offset = sm_cb->map_start_offset;
00355     old_max_init_offset = sm_cb->max_init_offset;
00356 
00357     /*
00358      * First calculate offset range into map array, using map start offset
00359      * to adjust offset (map_array[0] represents map_start_offset).
00360      */
00361     start_index = (old_max_init_offset + 1) - map_start_offset;
00362     end_index = new_max_init_offset - map_start_offset;
00363 
00364 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00365     printf ("  Expanding max init offset from %i to %i, index %i to %i\n",
00366             sm_cb->max_init_offset, new_max_init_offset, start_index, 
00367             end_index);
00368 #endif
00369 
00370 
00371     /* Initialize the necessary portions of the map.
00372      * Do 4 intializations per iteration to speed up the initialization.
00373      * I set up algorithm so that there is always a multiple of 4 elements 
00374      * need to be initialized!
00375      */
00376     map_array = sm_cb->map_array;
00377     for (index1 = start_index; index1 <= end_index;
00378          index1 += 4)
00379     {
00380         map_array[index1] = 0;
00381         map_array[index1+1] = 0;
00382         map_array[index1+2] = 0;
00383         map_array[index1+3] = 0;
00384 
00385 #if DEBUG_RMAP_RESIZE
00386         map_array[index1] = map_start_offset + index1 ;
00387         printf ("Setting map_array[%i] to %i\n", index1, map_array[index1]);
00388         map_array[index1+1] = map_start_offset + index1 +1;
00389         map_array[index1+2] = map_start_offset + index1 +2;
00390         map_array[index1+3] = map_start_offset + index1 +3;
00391 #endif
00392     }
00393     
00394     /* Set the new max_init_offset */
00395     sm_cb->max_init_offset = new_max_init_offset;
00396 
00397 #if DEBUG_RMAP_RESIZE
00398     OLD_SM_check_map (sm_cb);
00399 #endif
00400 }
00401 
00402 void OLD_SM_init_for_min_usage (OLD_SM_Cb *sm_cb, int min_usage_offset)
00403 {
00404     unsigned int *map_array;
00405     int old_min_init_offset, new_min_init_offset, map_start_offset;
00406     int start_index, end_index, index1;
00407 
00408     /* Calculate how far to intialize the map to, want to extend before present
00409      * need.  Want to initialize at least 4 elements before min_usage_offset. 
00410      * 
00411      * In order to do some hand unrolling optimizations of the resize
00412      * and intialization routines, always make the number of elements
00413      * initialized to a multiple of 4.  Thus make new_min_init_offset a 
00414      * (multiple of 4, since want numbering to start at a multiple of 4).
00415      * 
00416      * To accomplish this, zero the lower bits of min_usage offset 
00417      * (in effect, subtract up to 3).  Now have a multiple of 4.
00418      * Subtract 4, so the new_min_init_offset points somewhere between 
00419      * 4 and 7 entries before min_usage_offset, and is a multiple of 4.
00420      */
00421     new_min_init_offset = (min_usage_offset - (min_usage_offset & 3)) - 4;
00422 
00423     /* Do we need to resize the map_array? 
00424      * If min_usage_offset would fall withing the current array, don't
00425      * resize, just extend initialization as far as possible.
00426      */
00427     map_start_offset = sm_cb->map_start_offset;
00428     if (new_min_init_offset < map_start_offset)
00429     {
00430         /* Try to scale back new_min_init_offset if possible to avoid resize */
00431         if (map_start_offset <= min_usage_offset)
00432         {
00433             /* Since map_start_offset always a multiple of 4, unrolling
00434              * optimizations will still hold after setting to map_start_offset.
00435              */
00436             new_min_init_offset = map_start_offset;
00437         }
00438 
00439         /* Otherwise expand the map_start_offset to handle 
00440          * new_min_init_offset 
00441          */
00442         else
00443         {
00444             /* Changes the map start offset, so reload after expansion */
00445             OLD_SM_expand_map_start_offset (sm_cb, new_min_init_offset);
00446             map_start_offset = sm_cb->map_start_offset;
00447         }
00448     }
00449 
00450     /* Get sm_cb fields for speed and ease of use */
00451     old_min_init_offset = sm_cb->min_init_offset;
00452 
00453     /*
00454      * First calculate offset range into map array, using map start offset
00455      * to adjust offset (map_array[0] represents map_start_offset).
00456      */
00457     start_index = new_min_init_offset - map_start_offset;
00458     end_index = (old_min_init_offset -1) - map_start_offset;
00459 
00460 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00461     printf ("  Expanding min init offset from %i to %i, index %i to %i\n",
00462             sm_cb->min_init_offset, new_min_init_offset, end_index, 
00463             start_index);
00464 #endif
00465 
00466 
00467     /* Initialize the necessary portions of the map.
00468      * Do 4 intializations per iteration to speed up the initialization.
00469      * I set up algorithm so that there is always a multiple of 4 elements 
00470      * need to be initialized!
00471      */
00472     map_array = sm_cb->map_array;
00473     for (index1 = start_index; index1 <= end_index;
00474          index1 += 4)
00475     {
00476         map_array[index1] = 0 ;
00477         map_array[index1+1] = 0;
00478         map_array[index1+2] = 0;
00479         map_array[index1+3] = 0;
00480 
00481 #if DEBUG_RMAP_RESIZE
00482         map_array[index1] = map_start_offset + index1 ;
00483         printf ("Setting map_array[%i] to %i\n", index1, map_array[index1]);
00484         map_array[index1+1] = map_start_offset + index1 +1;
00485         map_array[index1+2] = map_start_offset + index1 +2;
00486         map_array[index1+3] = map_start_offset + index1 +3;
00487 #endif
00488     }
00489     
00490     /* Set the new min_init_offset */
00491     sm_cb->min_init_offset = new_min_init_offset;
00492 
00493 #if DEBUG_RMAP_RESIZE
00494     OLD_SM_check_map (sm_cb);
00495 #endif
00496 }
00497 
00498 void OLD_SM_create_map (OLD_SM_Cb *sm_cb, int min_usage_offset, int max_usage_offset)
00499 {
00500     int map_start_offset, map_array_size, malloc_size, min_init_offset;
00501     unsigned int *map_array;
00502 
00503     /* Start the map about 4-7 elements before the min_usage_offset, so
00504      * map can grow for a while in either direction (biased slightly
00505      * towards growing towards larger offsets).  
00506      * For loop optimizations, aways place map_start_offset on a offset that 
00507      * is a multiple of 4 (Want lower two bits to be zero to prevent
00508      * messing up the loop bound calculations).  
00509      */
00510     map_start_offset = (min_usage_offset - (min_usage_offset & 3)) - 4;
00511 
00512     /* Initially try to make map 32 elements long, grow if necessary.
00513      * Must be a power of two.  May want to make map initally larger.
00514      * Map is not intialized until needed, so making it map larger
00515      * initially decreases the number of resizes needed later.
00516      */
00517     map_array_size = 32;
00518     while ((map_start_offset + map_array_size) <= max_usage_offset)
00519         map_array_size = map_array_size << 1;
00520 
00521 
00522 
00523     /* Malloc map array */
00524     malloc_size = map_array_size * sizeof(unsigned int);
00525     if ((map_array = (unsigned int *) malloc(malloc_size)) == NULL)
00526         L_punt ("OLD_SM_create_map: Out of memory (size %i)", malloc_size);    
00527 
00528     /* Initialize sm_cb data structures */
00529     sm_cb->map_array = map_array;
00530     sm_cb->map_array_size = map_array_size;
00531     sm_cb->map_start_offset = map_start_offset;
00532     sm_cb->map_end_offset = map_start_offset + map_array_size - 1;
00533     
00534     /* Set the max_init_offset to be right before min_usage_offset and
00535      * min_init_offset to be max_init_offset + 1.
00536      * My loop optimization requires that max_init_offset be a 
00537      * (multiple of 4) -1! So move back min/max_init_offset appropriately.
00538      *
00539      * If min_usage_offset is 0, will get a min_init_offset of 0 and
00540      * a max_init_offset of -1.  (I.e., nothing initialized!)
00541      */
00542     min_init_offset = (min_usage_offset - (min_usage_offset & 3));
00543     sm_cb->min_init_offset = min_init_offset;
00544     sm_cb->max_init_offset = min_init_offset - 1;
00545 
00546 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00547     printf ("    Creating map: min %i max %i start %i end %i size %i min init %i max init %i\n", 
00548             min_usage_offset, max_usage_offset, map_start_offset, 
00549             sm_cb->map_end_offset,
00550             map_array_size, min_init_offset, sm_cb->max_init_offset);
00551 #endif
00552 
00553     /* Initialize the map from min_init_offset to max_usage_offset */
00554     OLD_SM_init_for_max_usage (sm_cb, max_usage_offset);
00555 }
00556 
00557 /* To get all the resource map worked out */
00558 int OLD_SM_sched_table (OLD_SM_Cb *sm_cb, SM_Table *table, int time, 
00559                     unsigned short min_slot, unsigned short max_slot,
00560                     int commit, Mdes_Stats *stats)
00561 {
00562     SM_Mdes *sm_mdes;
00563     int min_usage_offset, max_usage_offset, map_start_offset;
00564     unsigned int *map_array, *adjusted_map_array;
00565     unsigned short choice_array[100];
00566     int slot;
00567     int start_option_checks, start_usage_checks;
00568     int net_option_checks, net_usage_checks;
00569 
00570 #if TAKE_STATS
00571     stats->num_table_checks ++;
00572 #endif
00573 
00574     /* Get the SM mdes for ease of use */
00575     sm_mdes = sm_cb->sm_mdes;
00576 
00577     /* Calculate the min and max offset that will be tested for this table 
00578      * If more than 32 resources are used, then multiple map words per
00579      * cycle will be used.  This is handled using a time shift to calculate
00580      * the usage offsets.
00581      */
00582     min_usage_offset = time << sm_mdes->time_shift;
00583     max_usage_offset = min_usage_offset + table->max_usage_offset;
00584 
00585 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00586     printf ("Sched table at time %i, min offset %i, max offset %i\n", time, 
00587             min_usage_offset, max_usage_offset);
00588 #endif
00589 
00590     /* Create the map_array and initialize fields if necessary */
00591     if (sm_cb->map_array == NULL) 
00592         OLD_SM_create_map (sm_cb, min_usage_offset, max_usage_offset);
00593 
00594     /* If max_usage_offset extends past where initialized, initialize more */
00595     if (max_usage_offset > sm_cb->max_init_offset)
00596         OLD_SM_init_for_max_usage (sm_cb, max_usage_offset);
00597 
00598 
00599     /* If min_usage_offset extends below where initialized, initialize more */
00600     if (min_usage_offset < sm_cb->min_init_offset)
00601         OLD_SM_init_for_min_usage (sm_cb, min_usage_offset);
00602 
00603     /* Get the pointer to the map array, adjusting it work the schedule
00604      * time specified and for the map start offset.  The above functions
00605      * may change both map_array and map_start_offset, so must be
00606      * reloaded here!
00607      */
00608     map_array = sm_cb->map_array;
00609     map_start_offset = sm_cb->map_start_offset;
00610     adjusted_map_array = &map_array[min_usage_offset - map_start_offset];
00611     
00612 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00613     for (index = 0; index < table->num_choices; index++)
00614     {
00615         choice_array[index] = -1;
00616     }
00617 #endif
00618 
00619 #if TAKE_STATS
00620     /* Update choice distribution */
00621     increment_check_history (stats->num_choice_dist, 
00622                              (int)(table->last_choice -
00623                                    table->first_choice) + 1, 1);
00624     increment_check_history (stats->first_choice_dist, 
00625                              (int)(table->first_choice->last_option-
00626                                    table->first_choice->first_option)+1, 1);
00627 #endif
00628 
00629     /* Use existing stats to calculate net checks for this table */
00630     start_option_checks = stats->num_option_checks;
00631     start_usage_checks = stats->num_usage_checks;
00632 
00633     /* Try to schedule the table at this time */
00634     slot = OLD_SM_choose_first_avail_options (adjusted_map_array, table,
00635                                           choice_array, min_slot, max_slot,
00636                                           stats);
00637         
00638     net_option_checks = stats->num_option_checks - start_option_checks;
00639     net_usage_checks = stats->num_usage_checks - start_usage_checks;
00640 
00641     /* Were we successful? */
00642     if (slot >= 0)
00643     {
00644 #if TAKE_STATS
00645         /* Yes, update succeed distribution */
00646         increment_check_history (stats->succeed_option_check_dist,
00647                                  net_option_checks, 1);
00648         increment_check_history (stats->succeed_usage_check_dist,
00649                                  net_usage_checks, 1);
00650 #endif
00651 
00652         if (commit)
00653         {
00654 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00655             printf ("\n> Scheduling table at time %i in slot %i\n", time, 
00656                     slot);
00657             for (index = 0; index < table->num_choices; index++)
00658             {
00659                 printf ("  Choice %i: option %i\n", index, 
00660                         choice_array[index]);
00661             }
00662             printf ("\n");
00663 #endif
00664             
00665             OLD_SM_commit_choices (adjusted_map_array, table, choice_array);
00666         }
00667         return (slot);
00668     }
00669     else
00670     {
00671 
00672 #if TAKE_STATS
00673         /* No, update fail distribution */
00674         increment_check_history (stats->fail_option_check_dist,
00675                                  net_option_checks, 1);
00676         increment_check_history (stats->fail_usage_check_dist,
00677                                  net_usage_checks, 1);
00678 #endif
00679 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00680         if (commit)
00681         {
00682             printf ("Unable to schedule table at time %i (return value %i)\n", 
00683                 time, slot);
00684         }
00685 #endif
00686 #if TAKE_STATS
00687         stats->num_table_checks_failed ++;
00688 #endif
00689         return (-1);
00690     }
00691 }
00692 
00693 
00694 int OLD_SM_choose_first_avail_options (unsigned int *map, SM_Table *table,
00695                                    unsigned short *choices_made, 
00696                                    unsigned int min_slot, 
00697                                    unsigned int max_slot,
00698                                    Mdes_Stats *stats)
00699 {
00700     SM_Choice *choice_ptr, *first_choice, *last_choice, *slot_choice;
00701     SM_Option *option_ptr, *first_option, *last_option;
00702     SM_Usage *usage_ptr, *first_usage, *last_usage;
00703     unsigned short option_id, *choices_made_ptr;
00704     unsigned short *slot_options_ptr;
00705     unsigned int slot = 0;
00706     unsigned int map_contents, resources_used, map_offset;
00707 
00708     /* Get pointer to choices_made array for ease of use */
00709     choices_made_ptr = choices_made;
00710 
00711     /* Get the choice that sets the slot option for ease of use & speed */
00712     slot_choice = table->slot_choice;
00713 
00714     /* Get pointer to the slot options for the slot choice */
00715     slot_options_ptr = table->slot_options;
00716 
00717     /* Cache the choice array bounds for ease of use & speed */
00718     first_choice = table->first_choice;
00719     last_choice = table->last_choice;
00720 
00721 
00722     /* For each choice, pick the first option that is available */
00723     choice_ptr = first_choice;
00724     while (1)
00725     {
00726 #if DEBUG_RMAP 
00727         printf ("    Testing choice %i:\n", (int) (choice_ptr - first_choice));
00728 #endif
00729 
00730         /* Cache the option array bounds for ease of use & speed */
00731         first_option = choice_ptr->first_option;
00732         last_option = choice_ptr->last_option;
00733 
00734         /* Initialize the option id used for setting *choices_made_ptr */
00735         option_id = 0;
00736 
00737         /* Pick the first available option that has its resources available */
00738         option_ptr = first_option;
00739         while (1)
00740         {
00741 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00742             printf ("      Testing option %i:\n", 
00743                     (int) (option_ptr - first_option));
00744 #endif
00745 #if TAKE_STATS
00746             stats->num_option_checks ++;
00747 #endif
00748 
00749 
00750             /* Cache the usage array bounds for ease of use & speed */
00751             first_usage = option_ptr->first_usage;
00752             last_usage = option_ptr->last_usage;
00753             
00754             /* In order to choice this option, all resources used by
00755              * the usage array must be available in the resource map 
00756              */
00757             usage_ptr = first_usage;
00758             while (1)
00759             {
00760 
00761                 /* Cache the usage contents for ease of use & speed */
00762                 map_offset = usage_ptr->map_offset;
00763                 resources_used = usage_ptr->resources_used;
00764 
00765 #if TAKE_STATS
00766                 stats->num_usage_checks ++;
00767 #endif
00768 
00769 #if DEBUG_RMAP 
00770                 printf ("        Testing usage %i (offset %i mask %x)\n",
00771                         (int)(usage_ptr - first_usage), map_offset, 
00772                         resources_used);
00773 #endif
00774 
00775                 /* Get the contents of the resource map at this offset */
00776                 map_contents = map[map_offset];
00777 
00778                 /* Goto next usage while loading map_contents */
00779                 usage_ptr++;
00780 
00781                 /* Are the desired resources available (all desired bits 0)? */
00782                 if ((map_contents & resources_used) != 0)
00783                 {
00784 #if DEBUG_RMAP 
00785                     printf ("          Resources %x not available\n",
00786                             (map_contents & resources_used));
00787 #endif
00788 #if TAKE_STATS
00789                     stats->num_usage_checks_failed ++;
00790                     stats->num_option_checks_failed ++;
00791 #endif
00792 
00793                     /* Resources not available, flag by setting usage_ptr
00794                      * to NULL and exit loop so can try the next option 
00795                      */
00796                     usage_ptr = NULL;
00797                     break;
00798                 }
00799                 
00800                 /* Stop if have gotten all the desired resources */
00801                 if (usage_ptr > last_usage)
00802                     break;
00803             }
00804             
00805             /* For the slot choice, the option chosen also determines the
00806              * schedule slot.  Test only the slot choice options that
00807              * fall within the min_slot and max_slot bounds
00808              */
00809             if (choice_ptr == slot_choice)
00810             {
00811                 if (usage_ptr != NULL)
00812                 {
00813                     /* Get the slot for this option and update pointer*/
00814                     slot = *slot_options_ptr;
00815                     slot_options_ptr++;
00816                     
00817 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00818                     printf ("        Testing slot %i (dep allows %i-%i).\n",
00819                             slot, min_slot, max_slot);
00820 #endif
00821 #if TAKE_STATS
00822                     stats->num_slot_checks ++;
00823 #endif
00824                     
00825                     
00826                     /* Reject option if slot doesn't fall within required bounds */
00827                     if ((slot < min_slot) || (slot > max_slot))
00828                     {
00829 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00830                         printf ("          Slot %i rejected (dep allows %i-%i).\n",
00831                                 slot, min_slot, max_slot);
00832 #endif
00833 #if TAKE_STATS
00834                         stats->num_slot_checks_failed ++;
00835 
00836                         /* Update usage and option failed stats since
00837                          * they have failed due to slot constraints.
00838                          */
00839                         stats->num_usage_checks_failed ++;
00840                         stats->num_option_checks_failed ++;
00841 #endif
00842                         
00843                         /* Update state so we can goto next option */
00844                         option_ptr++;
00845                         option_id++;
00846                         
00847                         /* If we have used up all the options and have not found
00848                          * one that can be scheduled, return -1
00849                          */
00850                         if (option_ptr > last_option)
00851                             return (-1);
00852                         
00853                         /* Goto next option */
00854                         continue;
00855                     }
00856                 }
00857 
00858                 /* If resources are not available, just update pointer */
00859                 else
00860                 {
00861                     slot_options_ptr++;
00862                 }
00863             }
00864 
00865             /* If option is available (usage_ptr != NULL), set the
00866              * option used in the choices made array and exit loop
00867              * so can go to next choice.
00868              */
00869             if (usage_ptr != NULL)
00870             {
00871                 
00872                 /* If here, then resources and slot constraints are met! */
00873 
00874 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00875                 if (lmdes->mdes2 != NULL)
00876                 {
00877                     printf ("  Option %i available:\n",
00878                             (int) (option_ptr - first_option));
00879                     OLD_SM_print_option (stdout, lmdes->mdes2->sm_mdes, 
00880                                      option_ptr);
00881                 }
00882 #endif                               
00883 
00884                 /* Update the choices_made array */
00885                 *choices_made_ptr = option_id;
00886                 
00887                 /* Goto next choice */
00888                 break;
00889             }
00890 
00891             /* All loop update code (below this point) must also be placed
00892              * in the slot bound testing code at the beginning of this loop!
00893              */
00894 
00895             /* Update option_ptr and option_id before trying next option */
00896             option_ptr++;
00897             option_id++;
00898 
00899             /* If we have used up all the options and have not found
00900              * one that can be scheduled, return -1
00901              */
00902             if (option_ptr > last_option)
00903                 return (-1);
00904         }
00905 
00906         /* Update choice_ptr and choices_made_ptr before try next choice */
00907         choice_ptr++;
00908         choices_made_ptr++;
00909 
00910         /* Stop if we have sucessfully selected an option for each choice */
00911         if (choice_ptr > last_choice)
00912             break;
00913     }
00914 
00915     /* We have successfully selected the first option available for each
00916      * choice.  Return the slot choosen to signal success.
00917      */
00918     return ((int)slot);
00919 }
00920 
00921 void OLD_SM_commit_choices (unsigned int *map, SM_Table *table,
00922                        unsigned short *choices_made)
00923 {
00924     SM_Choice *choice_ptr, *first_choice, *last_choice;
00925     SM_Option *option_ptr, *option_array;
00926     SM_Usage *usage_ptr, *first_usage, *last_usage;
00927     unsigned short option_id, *choices_made_ptr;
00928     unsigned int map_contents, resources_used, map_offset;
00929 
00930 
00931     /* Get pointer to choices_made array for clarity */
00932     choices_made_ptr = choices_made;
00933 
00934     /* Cache the choice array bounds for ease of use & speed */
00935     first_choice = table->first_choice;
00936     last_choice = table->last_choice;
00937 
00938 
00939     /* Commit all the resources for each specified choice */
00940     choice_ptr = first_choice;
00941     while (1)
00942     {
00943 
00944 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00945         printf ("    Committing choice %i:\n", 
00946                 (int) (choice_ptr - first_choice));
00947 #endif
00948 
00949         /* Load the option id chosen */
00950         option_id = *choices_made_ptr;
00951 
00952         /* Load the option array for this choice */
00953         option_array = choice_ptr->first_option;
00954 
00955         /* Get a pointer to the option selected */
00956         option_ptr = &option_array[option_id];
00957         
00958 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00959         printf ("      Committing option %i:\n",
00960                     (int) (option_ptr - option_array));
00961 #endif
00962 
00963         /* Cache the usage array bounds for ease of use & speed */
00964         first_usage = option_ptr->first_usage;
00965         last_usage = option_ptr->last_usage;
00966 
00967         /* In order to choice this option, all resources used by
00968          * the usage array must be available in the resource map
00969          */
00970         usage_ptr = first_usage;
00971         while (1)
00972         {
00973             /* Cache the usage contents for ease of use & speed */
00974             map_offset = usage_ptr->map_offset;
00975             resources_used = usage_ptr->resources_used;
00976 
00977 
00978             /* Get the contents of the resource map at this offset */
00979             map_contents = map[map_offset];
00980 
00981             /* Mark the resources as used in the map_contents */
00982             map_contents = map_contents | resources_used;
00983 
00984 #if DEBUG_RMAP
00985             printf ("        Committing usage %i (offset %i mask %x). Before %x after %x\n",
00986                     (int)(usage_ptr - first_usage), map_offset,
00987                     resources_used, map[map_offset], map_contents);
00988 #endif
00989 
00990             /* Store the new map contents to the map */
00991             map[map_offset] = map_contents;
00992 
00993 
00994             
00995             /* Goto next usage */
00996             usage_ptr++;
00997 
00998             /* Stop after committing all the desired resource usages */
00999             if (usage_ptr > last_usage)
01000                 break;
01001         }
01002 
01003         /* Update choice_ptr and choices_made_ptr before committing the next 
01004          * choice 
01005          */
01006         choice_ptr++;
01007         choices_made_ptr++;
01008 
01009         /* Stop if we have committed each choice */
01010         if (choice_ptr > last_choice)
01011             break;
01012     }
01013 }
01014 
01015 /* Prints the resource usages for the passed option to the file "out".  */
01016 void OLD_SM_print_option (FILE *out, SM_Mdes *sm_mdes, SM_Option *option)
01017 {
01018     SM_Usage *usage;
01019     unsigned short resource_offset, offset_mask;
01020     SM_Resource *resource;
01021     unsigned int num_resources, time_shift, usage_time, resources_used;
01022     int index;
01023     
01024     /* Cache some sm_mdes fields for speed and ease of use */
01025     num_resources = sm_mdes->num_resources;
01026     time_shift = sm_mdes->time_shift;
01027     resource = sm_mdes->resource;
01028 
01029     offset_mask = ((unsigned short) sm_mdes->map_width) - 1;
01030 
01031     for (usage = option->first_usage; usage <= option->first_usage;
01032          usage++)
01033     {
01034         resources_used = usage->resources_used;
01035         resource_offset = usage->map_offset & offset_mask;
01036         usage_time = usage->map_offset >> time_shift;
01037         fprintf (out, " @%2i:", usage_time);
01038         
01039         for (index=0; index < num_resources; index++)
01040         {
01041             if ((resource_offset == resource[index].offset) &&
01042                 ((resources_used & resource[index].mask) != 0))
01043                 fprintf (out, " %s", resource[index].name);
01044         }
01045         fprintf (out, "\n");
01046     }
01047 }
01048 
01049 void OLD_SM_print_map (FILE *out, SM_Mdes *sm_mdes, OLD_SM_Cb *sm_cb)
01050 {
01051     int start_time, end_time, time, time_shift, num_resources, usage_offset;
01052     int map_start_offset, offset_per_cycle, empty;
01053     SM_Resource *resource_array, *resource;
01054     unsigned int *adjusted_map_array, *map_array;
01055     int index1, index2;
01056 
01057     /* Get the time shift for the mdes */
01058     time_shift = sm_mdes->time_shift;
01059     offset_per_cycle = 1 << time_shift;
01060 
01061     map_array = sm_cb->map_array;
01062     map_start_offset = sm_cb->map_start_offset;
01063 
01064     start_time = sm_cb->min_init_offset >> time_shift;
01065     end_time = ((sm_cb->max_init_offset + 1) >> time_shift) -1;
01066 
01067     /* Move start time up until the first cycle resources are used */
01068     while (start_time <= end_time)
01069     {
01070         usage_offset = start_time << time_shift;
01071 
01072         /* Move adjusted_map to the start of this cycle */
01073         adjusted_map_array = &map_array[usage_offset - map_start_offset];
01074 
01075         empty = 1;
01076         for (index1 = 0; index1 < offset_per_cycle; index1++)
01077         {
01078             if (adjusted_map_array[index1] != 0)
01079             {
01080                 empty = 0;
01081                 break;
01082             }
01083         }
01084         if (empty)
01085         {
01086             start_time++;
01087         }
01088         else
01089             break;
01090     }
01091 
01092     /* Move end time up until the last cycle resources are used */
01093     while (end_time >= start_time)
01094     {
01095         usage_offset = end_time << time_shift;
01096 
01097         /* Move adjusted_map to the start of this cycle */
01098         adjusted_map_array = &map_array[usage_offset - map_start_offset];
01099 
01100         empty = 1;
01101         for (index1 = 0; index1 < offset_per_cycle; index1++)
01102         {
01103             if (adjusted_map_array[index1] != 0)
01104             {
01105                 empty = 0;
01106                 break;
01107             }
01108         }
01109         if (empty)
01110         {
01111             end_time--;
01112         }
01113         else
01114             break;
01115     }
01116 
01117     num_resources = sm_mdes->num_resources;
01118     resource_array = sm_mdes->resource;
01119     
01120     for (time = start_time; time <= end_time; time++)
01121     {
01122         fprintf (out, "%3i:", time);
01123 
01124         usage_offset = time << time_shift;
01125 
01126         /* Move adjusted_map to the start of this cycle */
01127         adjusted_map_array = &map_array[usage_offset - map_start_offset];
01128 
01129         for (index1=0; index1 < num_resources; index1++)
01130         {
01131             resource = &resource_array[index1];
01132             if (adjusted_map_array[resource->offset] & resource->mask)
01133                 fprintf (out, " %s", resource->name);
01134             else
01135             {
01136                 fprintf (out, " ");
01137                 for (index2 = 0; resource->name[index2] != 0; index2++)
01138                     fprintf (out, " ");
01139             }
01140         }
01141         fprintf (out, "\n");
01142     }
01143 }
01144 
01145 
01146 void OLD_SM_print_stats (FILE *out, Mdes_Stats *stats)
01147 {
01148     fprintf (out, "%12i Operation checks.\n", stats->num_oper_checks);
01149     fprintf (out, "%12i Operation checks failed.\n", 
01150              stats->num_oper_checks_failed);
01151 
01152     fprintf (out, "%12i Tables checks.\n", stats->num_table_checks);
01153     fprintf (out, "%12i Tables checks failed.\n", 
01154              stats->num_table_checks_failed);
01155 
01156     fprintf (out, "%12i Slot checks.\n", stats->num_slot_checks);
01157     fprintf (out, "%12i Slot checks failed.\n", 
01158              stats->num_slot_checks_failed);
01159 
01160     fprintf (out, "%12i Usage checks.\n", stats->num_usage_checks);
01161     fprintf (out, "%12i Usage checks failed.\n", 
01162              stats->num_usage_checks_failed);
01163 }
